alert.note: Alert for Paradox Valley, Lower Dolores River (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 19 at 12:43PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A line of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern San Miguel, southwestern Montrose and northeastern San Juan Counties through 115 PM MDT... At 1241 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of strong thunderstorms near La Sal, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern San Miguel, southwestern Montrose and northeastern San Juan Counties, including the following locations... Paradox, Dead Horse Point State Park, Bedrock and La Sal Junction. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 191 in Utah between mile markers 89 and 120. Utah 279 near mile marker 0. Utah 313 between mile markers 0 and 4. Colorado 90 between mile markers 1 and 24. Colorado 141 between mile markers 77 and 96. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
